item.title: Netflix Considered Buying EA and Disney
item.content:encoded:
A new report reveals that Netflix considered acquiring Electronic Arts, Disney, and Fox, but none of those deals came to fruition.

Netflix is the new big dog in town, ever since it announced that the company would acquire Warner Bros. for $82.7 billion in 2026, likely giving it access to studios like NetherRealm, Rocksteady, TT Games, and Avalanche. New details reveal they have considered buying other major companies, including EA and Disney.

Netflix ‘Debated Pursuing’ EA, Disney, and Fox

A new Bloomberg report about Netflix CEO wooing Trump ahead of Warner Bros.’ bid says the company considered acquisitions of EA, Disney, and Fox. It first talks about how Netflix is an “unlikely bidder”, as co-founder and chairman, Reed Hastings, avoids major deals to build things “from scratch”. The company’s management “debated pursuing just about every major asset put up for sale, including Electronic Arts Inc. and Fox.” They also considered acquiring Disney at one point.

However, the “executives could never coalesce behind a deal.” Additionally, the execs didn’t want to “hurt their stock price by overpaying for an asset that traded at a much lower multiple.” Netflix’s co-CEO Greg Peters also stated, ahead of the acquisition of Warner Bros., that “One should have a reasonable amount of skepticism around big media mergers, they don’t have an amazing track record,” which led people to think Netflix was not interested in the deal.

In other news, here is every studio that was affected by the Warner Bros & Netflix merger. Additionally, Paramount has made a hostile offer to acquire Warner Bros. What are your thoughts on Netflix considering buying EA and Disney? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Saros being rated in Taiwan. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7 Release Date & All Content, Explained
item.content:encoded:
The Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7 release date carries on Epic’s new mission to let everyone relive the early years by experiencing older content again from top to bottom. Key content for Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7 has been revealed, showing you what you can look forward to for several weeks.

Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7 celebrates the battle royale’s Christmas period from SEVEN years ago. The game has changed dramatically over the last seven years, and while Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1 begins the next significant milestone in the game’s history, it’s time for a Holiday throwback.

OG Chapter 1 Season 7 brings back some banging skins and some beloved POIs and weapons.

When Is Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7 Coming Out?

Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7 releases on December 11, exactly two weeks out from Christmas Day!

It’s time to put in some real work. Alongside Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1 is OG Chapter 1 Season 7. It’s a testament to Epic to keep so many areas of the game in operation at once. But the nostalgic return to bygone Fortnite eras has been a huge dub in the community.

The OG Chapter 1 Season 7’s tagline was “You Better Watch Out,” and Insider Gaming will tell you why.

All Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7 Loot Pool Changes

Alongside returning Xmas-themed POIs and a new OG Battle Pass, you can look forward to the Boom Box, Stink Bombs, a Scoped Revolver, and much more in Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7.

Here’s a quick summary of every item outed by Epic Games ahead of Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7 so far:

  • Balloons
  • Boom Box
  • Dual Pistols
  • Glider Redeploy
  • Infinity Blade (In-Season)
  • New Battle Pass
  • New POIs
    • Polar Peak
    • Happy Hamlet
    • Frosty Flights
  • New Skins
  • New Umbrella
  • Other Map Updates
  • Scoped AR
  • Scoped Revolver
  • Stink Bombs
  • Suppressed Sniper Rifle
  • X-4 Stormwing

Chapter 7’s storyline was a fairly new narrative more in keeping with the theme of Christmas. You too can experience this all for yourself when Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7 drops a few days from now.

Tell us about your favorite Chapter 1 Season 7 memories if you played the original content all those years ago. Where does it rank amongst the very best? The free-to-join Insider Gaming Discord Server is the perfect place to let it all out.

For more information on all things Fortnite, make sure you read about a juicy leak suggesting Five-Player Squads Are Coming to Fortnite, the Long-Awaited Fortnite Skin Now Being Available, But Costing $170, and New Details About The Alleged South Park Collaboration.

item.title: First Player to Escape from Tarkov Gets Unique ‘Streamer Item’
item.content:encoded:
Tigz, who was documented last week as being the first person in the world to successfully escape from Tarkov, has been awarded a unique streamer item by Battlestate Games. These items are used to represent the respect that Battlestate Games has for the content creators who pour their lives into pulling Escape from Tarkov into the limelight time and again.

There are dozens of streamer items in the game, but the latest one belongs to Tigz, and it’s a tongue-in-cheek reference to the failed runs that prevented him from getting out of Tarkov without too many issues.

Tigz Has a Streamer Item

Tigz has a unique streamer item that’s reminiscent of his time spent escaping through Terminal, the final map in Battlestate Games’ tough extraction shooter. In his first attempt, which was watched by tens of thousands of people, Tigz fell short of the ending after failing to find a splint to patch an injury that ultimately led to his death.

That forced him to try again, numerous times.

To honor and recognize that moment, Battlestate Games created a unique splint for Tigz’s streamer item – Tigzresq. It’s a 67-inch splint in a red and black design that may or may not be practical. Streamer items are rarely practical, but if any will have an honest, in-game use, it’s the Tigzresq.

Another streamer item with a practical use is Gingy’s keychain, which does what you’d imagine and holds keys. There’s also WillerZ’s wallet, the RatCola, sprats, and a jar of mayo, amongst other things.

Whenever someone becomes big for streaming Escape from Tarkov, their streamer item is never too far behind. Fans of TheBurntPeanut, who recently won awards at The Streamer Awards, are clamouring for a unique item in Escape from Tarkov, given the amount of time the VTuber (sorry, PTuber) has spent in the game in recent years.

If you had a streamer item in Escape from Tarkov, what would it be? Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Saros has been rated in Taiwan
